pull.title: [Qt] show client user agent in debug window
pull.body:
![subver](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1419649/9112889/e577bb7c-3c51-11e5-8f99-5fffabe322e5.png)

I added the same indentation to the subversion as we have for the lib versions, this is just an obsolete screenshot.

events.body: Small nit: let's call it "User agent" instead of "Client subversion". I can see "subversion" resulting in quite funny translations, and more people will understand it by comparing it to HTTP user agent (that's also why we use option `-uacomment`)
Do we need starting and trailing `/` in Client version and User agent/Client subversion at all?
IMO, yes. Don't try to be smart and just report as it is sent to the P2P network.
+1 for `User Agent` (The Peers-tab in the debug window already calls it that way)

events.message: [Qt] show client user agent in debug window

rename.from: [Qt] show client subversion in debug window
rename.to: [Qt] show client user agent in debug window

events.body: Tested ACK. +1 for user agent.
